questionTitle: "What is the ................... of the noun formed from "improve"? "I-M-P-R-O-V-E-M-E-N-T. There's an "e" after the "v".
After closing the ................, Barbara stuck the stamps on it firmly.
"What does "UK" mean?". "It's the ................ for United Kingdom."
It's not easy ................ for a job at her age.
I wish I ................ to the disco with my friends last night.
Her husband didn't like the shirt, so she took it back to the shop .......... she had bought it.
"What does "shove off" mean?" "It means "go away" but it's .................. Don't use it."
I'm practising speaking English a lot ..................... I don't want to fail in the oral test.
Kris has taken a part-time job as a waiter ................. he can earn enough money to go to college.
Goats live three times as .................. as mice.
When it began to rain, they ................ in the school-yard .
The final ................ of the play will take place next week.
The creature with .................... life is the fly.
The ..................... has already fallen to 2oC and a very cold night is forecast.
dropping out of the race, however, she bravely limped to the finishing line.
It's ................ pity that we cannot come to your birthday party.
It was ................ a good concert that everybody kept talking about it.
The crowd of students shouted "................ imperialism!"
After ................... by a policeman, the man was sent back to America.
